text: What might inquiry look like in a language class? The kids went out in pairs with cameras to take photos of trees. Â Next they uploaded their photos to the shared-drive so that everyone could share. Â My intention was to create a voicethread using the photos, but there were technical issues on the day, so at the last minute, I simply asked them to use the photos in a power-point presentation and insert audio to record what they wanted to say in Hebrew. Â Lots of skills were evident: findingÂ appropriateÂ vocabulary, speaking and listening; many kids wrote what they wanted to say first, so reading and writing too; collaboration, creativity, thinking, communication, cooperation, not to mention various tech skills.
